turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about XIV International Brigade.
turn.1: What was the XIV International Brigade?
turn.2: XIV International Brigade The XIV International Brigade was one of several international brigades that fought for the Spanish Second Republic during the Spanish Civil War.
turn.4: It was raised on 20 December 1936 with volunteers mainly from France and Belgium, under General "Walter" (Karol Świerczewski).
turn.5: What is an interesting fact about this article?
turn.6: This Brigade was the fourth of the international brigades, and it mixed veterans with new, idealistic volunteers.
turn.8: It was formally named the Marseillaise Brigade, after the French revolutionary song (and national anthem).
turn.9: What happen in the Spanish Civil War?
turn.10: With subsequent consolidations and reorganisations, the XIV International Brigade included, among others, the following battalions: all or elements of the following units: The brigade fought in the battles of Lopera, the Corunna Road, Jarama, and the Segovia Offensive.
turn.12: After the Nationalist strategic victory in the Battle of Brunete (6–25 July 1937), heavy losses reduced the brigade strength from four to two battalions.
